title: Ultimate NASCAR Trivia Challenge - Part 3
description: Test your NASCAR knowledge with this third set of 50 challenging questions covering drivers, races, history, and more!

questions.question: What is the name of NASCAR's aerodynamic package introduced in 2019?
Which NASCAR driver has the nickname 'The Rocket Man'?
What is the name of the trophy given to the winner of the Southern 500?
Who was the first driver to win a NASCAR race in all three national series?
What is the term for when a car deliberately slows down to cool its engine in NASCAR?
Which track hosts NASCAR's longest continuous night race?
What is the name of NASCAR's overtime rule?
Who holds the record for most pole positions in NASCAR Cup Series history?
What is the name of the safety feature that absorbs energy in a crash, introduced in 2011?
Which driver has won the most consecutive races in the modern era of NASCAR?
What is the name of NASCAR's playoff elimination format introduced in 2014?
Who was the first driver to win a NASCAR Cup Series race in a Pontiac?
What is the term for when a car deliberately blocks another car from passing in NASCAR?
Which NASCAR driver has the nickname 'The Outlaw'?
What is the name of NASCAR's rule that requires a minimum speed during a race?
Who was the first driver to win a NASCAR Cup Series race in all three makes (Ford, Chevrolet, Dodge) in the modern era?
What is the term for when a car deliberately follows closely behind another car to reduce air resistance in NASCAR?
Which track hosts NASCAR's only dirt race in the Cup Series?
What is the name of NASCAR's rule that allows free pit stops during a caution period?
Who holds the record for most laps led in NASCAR Cup Series history?
What is the name of NASCAR's rule that allows a 'lucky dog' to regain a lap during a caution?
Which driver has won the most races at a single track in NASCAR Cup Series history?
What is the term for when a car deliberately follows another car closely to 'loosen' it up in NASCAR?
Who was the first driver to win a NASCAR Cup Series championship in his rookie year?
What is the name of NASCAR's rule that requires a car to pit after receiving multiple warnings?
Which NASCAR driver has the nickname 'The Iceman'?
What is the term for when a car deliberately slows down to allow a teammate to pass in NASCAR?
Who holds the record for most top-5 finishes in NASCAR Cup Series history?
What is the name of NASCAR's rule that allows teams to work on cars during a red flag period?
Which driver has won the most consecutive poles in NASCAR Cup Series history?
What is the term for when a car deliberately follows another car closely to cool its engine in NASCAR?
Who was the first driver to win a NASCAR Cup Series race on a road course and an oval in the same year?
What is the name of NASCAR's rule that requires a driver to complete the last lap under green flag conditions?
Which NASCAR driver has the nickname 'Mr. September'?
What is the term for when a car deliberately slows down to allow a lapped car to pass in NASCAR?
Who holds the record for most top-10 finishes in NASCAR Cup Series history?
What is the name of NASCAR's rule that allows a car to make a pit stop without losing a lap during a green flag period?
Which driver has won the most races in a single season in the modern era of NASCAR?
What is the term for when a car deliberately follows another car closely to push it forward in NASCAR?
Who was the first driver to win a NASCAR Cup Series race in his very first start?
What is the name of NASCAR's rule that requires a car to maintain a certain speed on pit road?
Which NASCAR driver has the nickname 'Front Row Joe'?
What is the term for when a car deliberately slows down to break the draft in NASCAR?
Who holds the record for most miles led in NASCAR Cup Series history?
What is the name of NASCAR's rule that allows a team to make a crew member change during a race?
Which driver has won the most road course races in NASCAR Cup Series history?
What is the term for when a car deliberately follows another car closely to create a vacuum in NASCAR?
Who was the first driver to win a NASCAR Cup Series race on a superspeedway, short track, and road course?
What is the name of NASCAR's rule that requires a driver to attempt to qualify for every race to be eligible for the championship?
